intro: Tarenna supra-axillaris, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, opposite leaves, and small, fragrant flowers. It produces yellowish-white berries that are typically eaten by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
